snippet: A comparison of China to Nazi Germany raises the question of how journalists based in China can continue to write compelling stories about an important but authoritarian country without suffering repercussions.
abstract: A comparison of China to Nazi Germany raises the question of how journalists based in China can continue to write compelling stories about an important but authoritarian country without suffering repercussions.
lead_paragraph: ‘‘I ask myself why I stay on here,’’ William L. Shirer wrote in Berlin on Sept. 20, 1940, as World War II deepened and Nazi censorship of his CBS radio broadcasts became intolerable.

headline.main: Navigating the Constraints on Reporting from China
